bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, January 28, 1926

div1.p: Siler sends Emilie Reed a manuscript he has submitted to Hygeia, the health journal of the American Medical Association, on Walter Reed and yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, January 28, 1926
div1.opener:
IN REPLY REFER TO S. G. O.____________________
jfs-mon
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON
January 28, 1926.
Mrs. Walter Reed,
The Burlington,
1120 Vermont Avenue, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
Recently General Ireland has asked me to
prepare a note on Major Reed's contribution to med-
ical science. Thinking that you may be interested
in my feeble effort, I am inclosing herewith a copy
of the manuscript. This article is being sent to
Hygeia, the health journal of the American Medical
Association, and if accepted should appear in the
near future.

Mrs. Siler and I expect to come around to
see you in the very near future and we both hope
that you and Blossom are quite well and are enjoying
the cold weather.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler ALL COMMUNICATIONS SHOULD BE ADDRESSED TO “THE SURGEON GENERAL, U. S. ARMY, WASHINGTON, D. C.”
